content.detail: For a Social Interaction Design course, my group chose to implement more social interaction design patterns into an after-school program in Chicago known as Digital Divas, a program that encourages and empowers young girls to complete STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) projects today and in their future.

content.title: Storyboards
content.detail:
We ultimately chose to design a new app, primarily for tablet devices, that provided users the opportunity to go through 2 different experience flows:

  1. A Gamification Flow where users can collect rewards and badges for finishing projects
  2. A Collaboration Flow where users can follow friend activity and communicate with others as individuals or groups

content.title: Wireframes
content.detail:
Sketched storyboards allowed us to explore these flows and confirm the design patterns selected that would be incorporated into our wireframes.

Design patterns included:

  • Points
  • Labels
  • Share Widget
  • Profile Customization
  • Calendar
  • Invite Friends
  • Private Conversation
  • Video Chat
  • Log In/Sign up
  • Buddy List
  • Avatar
  • Personal Dashboard
  • Adding Friends
  • Activity Stream
  • Collectible Achievements

images.alt: Wireframe drawing of direct message chat

content.title: Prototype
content.detail: After a heuristic evaluation from our peers and a personal evaluation of our project so far, we moved forward with making our wireframes interactive and creating our final prototype.
